Give a reason for your answer.

features.html:
The volume of a spherical hot air balloon expands as the air inside the balloon is heated. The radius of the balloon, in feet, is modeled by a twice-differentiable function r of time t, where t is measured in minutes. For 0 < t < 12, the graph of r is concave down. The table above gives selected values of the rate of change, r'(t), of radius of the balloon over the time interval  0 ≤ t ≤ 12 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CA8@ . The radius of the balloon is 30 feet when t = 5.

(Note: The volume of a sphere of radius r is given by V= 4 3 π r 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D7B@ .)
